name: Broth
description: A bone broth simmered with onions and aromatics (cinnamon, ginger, anise, cardamom) for 10 hours before serving. This has existed since long before bone broth became “trendy” in the states.

name: Noodles
description: The quintessential thin rice noodles that make a pho dish pho.

name: Brisket
description: Roast beef, cooked in the bone broth during the broth-making process. Pro tip: You can request lean or fatty (gầu) cuts of brisket at most restaurants.

name: Steak
description: Rare cut of beef that’s placed in the pho bowl just before serving. More tender than eye-round steak, which is a popular ingredient at other restaurants.

name: Tripe
description: Adds a rubbery, chewy texture.

name: Meatballs
description: Made from a mixture of ground beef and tendon. More chewy than Italian meatballs.

name: Tendon
description: Adds flavor and a gelatinous texture to the dish, similar to that of tapioca balls.

name: Chicken
description: Boiled strips of chicken breast. Other restaurants may have shredded chicken meat.

name: Prawns
description: For those who prefer seafood to beef. Veggie broth may be available upon request (at Pho Bac’s Denny Triangle location, for example).

name: Veggies
description: For the plant-inclined. Veggie broth may be available upon request (at Pho Bac’s Denny Triangle location, for example).

name: Thai basil
description: Tear off the leaves and add them to the dish, to your taste. This typically comes on the side with the pho dish.

name: Bean sprouts
description: Add more texture than flavor, and the earlier/longer you leave them in your pho broth, the softer they’ll get. These typically come on the side with the pho dish.

name: Lime wedges
description: Squeeze some lime juice into your broth to add tartness. These typically come on the side with the pho dish.

name: Jalapeno peppers
description: A substitute for the Thai chili peppers traditionally used in pho, which weren’t available at the time Pho Bac opened.

name: Fried shallots
description: Crispy and flavorful. Can be used to garnish the pho. Available upon request.

name: Sliced onions
description: In vinegar-sugar mixture. Add for a sweet-tart taste. Available upon request.

name: Cilantro
description: With onions and green onions. Add to your taste. Available upon request.

name: Fatty broth
description: A gloriously flavorful dish of fat from the broth with green onions. The onions are often put in the pho dish, while hoisin and sriracha can be added to the fatty broth for a meat dip.

name: Chinese donut
description: Offered at Pho Bac as an optional go-along with your pho. Eat it separately, or dip in the broth. Another popular pho restaurant offering is the cream puff, or banh su, a Vietnamese dessert with French origins.

name: Shark Brand sriracha
description: A milder, sweet, vinegar-based hot sauce.

name: “Rooster sauce” sriracha
description: A spicier, more common hot sauce.

name: Sambal
description: Another (slightly less spicy) hot sauce, made from chili peppers.

name: Hoisin sauce
description: A sweet-salty sauce that’s sometimes used on the side for dipping meat.
